snippet.textDisplay:
There is sooo many bots in comment section xD complaining on pvp and saying rarity of weapon should be stronger if its cooler color xDD guys you dont understand the point of the game. Legendary weapons should not be Overpowered.... they should have different use. Wich they have... kill big arcs.... There is a reason it is this way and you would never get it. 

They dont want unfair pvp and gameplay. If all the chads have all the legendary weapons no one of you would be able to play the game cus only the rich kids and chads would wipe every group and every person. Its about fairness and to not break a beautiful system they have. Other extraction shooters struggle with this. Unless your a gave developper or high rank in video games you should not talk or have opinions on all of this different type of stuff.

This is not cod or xbox playstation, get with the system and understand this is almost the most fair game on the market atm so be quiet

snippet.textDisplay:
Arc Raiders:
Why not make it both PvPvE and PvE?
You don't have to change much, but give people the chance to choose which of the two they want to play. Therefore you'll attract alot more PvE players to your game.

- In PvE mode, you only need to disable Player vs Player DMG, increase Arc spawns slightly, and keep the loot the same.
- In PvPvE mode, just increase the loot a bit so people still want to play because there's a better loot table.

And maybe include some Legendary in PvPvE so that even if PvE players want to find them they still have to do PvPvE occasionally, but that's their choice to do so.
That way, you'll ultimately make everyone happy and likely attract many more players to your game.
And with subsequent updates, you don't have to do anything other than what's planned, just keep those two points.

What do you all think if they did this ?
snippet.textOriginal:
Arc Raiders:
Why not make it both PvPvE and PvE?
You don't have to change much, but give people the chance to choose which of the two they want to play. Therefore you'll attract alot more PvE players to your game.

- In PvE mode, you only need to disable Player vs Player DMG, increase Arc spawns slightly, and keep the loot the same.
- In PvPvE mode, just increase the loot a bit so people still want to play because there's a better loot table.

And maybe include some Legendary in PvPvE so that even if PvE players want to find them they still have to do PvPvE occasionally, but that's their choice to do so.
That way, you'll ultimately make everyone happy and likely attract many more players to your game.
And with subsequent updates, you don't have to do anything other than what's planned, just keep those two points.

What do you all think if they did this ?

snippet.textDisplay: None of the higher tier weapons are viable or practical for most players. Sticking with a fully leveled Ferro/Stitcher combo will be just as good, if not better for PvP, than most other combos involving higher tier weapons. For PvE there are plenty of other, better, options. In terms of time, hassle, resources, cost, hunting and crafting these purpose weapons is a waste.
snippet.textOriginal: None of the higher tier weapons are viable or practical for most players. Sticking with a fully leveled Ferro/Stitcher combo will be just as good, if not better for PvP, than most other combos involving higher tier weapons. For PvE there are plenty of other, better, options. In terms of time, hassle, resources, cost, hunting and crafting these purpose weapons is a waste.

snippet.textDisplay: I used the hullcracker yesterday, and it felt like a waste of time, and money. It was only good for smaller arc enemies. I mean, it’s good, but definitely not what it used to be. It works great on weak points. I just threw Wolfpacks, or used deadlines against the bigger arc. The hullcracker is basically good for wasp, and hornet killing now. A dude asked me if I was missing on a bastion yesterday because it was taking so long. I didn’t upgrade it, nor would I upgrade a hullcracker at this point. If you want to fire shots from far away, it could still be useful, and more quiet than a ferro, but eh. It was underwhelming. I gave one away to a dude that started a bastion fight, and I came in after with the hullcracker to do the majority of the damage. It was focused on me the whole time, so it still packs a punch, but there’s just better, quicker, and cheaper ways now. I don’t care about losing a hullcracker which makes it more friendly to bring into raid now though, so there’s that. I have a bunch of them, so I’m just using them until I lose them. I lost one to a rocketeer, and one to a random PvP encounter yesterday, and you still feel the funk of losing, but eh. It’s not even that serious overall. I actually didn’t weapon swap and hit the player with a hullcracker round on the first shot instead of my ferro. Had no chance after that. Hearing the “plop” instead of a ferro shot and a shield break made me laugh at myself. I just stood in my smoke from the broken shield, and invited the death.

snippet.textDisplay: IT'S not bad.. it replaces the Hull-Cracker as the Hull stripper for Arc. The Devs basically made PVE harder for casuals since they can't just rely on the daily hullcracker reset anymore to do Arc efficiently. Matriarchs suddenly became important. I've done 8 Matriach runs and 6 times the blueprint dropped from its core so its not even going to be rare within a few days.
